snippet: As the A.F.L.-C.I.O.'s winter meeting opened here on Tuesday, its political director mapped out organized labor's plans for the 2012 campaign and how unions will respond to what he says will be $500 million in "super PAC" ads backing Republicans.
abstract: As the A.F.L.-C.I.O.'s winter meeting opened here on Tuesday, its political director mapped out organized labor's plans for the 2012 campaign and how unions will respond to what he says will be $500 million in "super PAC" ads backing Republicans.

headline.main: Organized Labor Sets Course for Election
headline.print_headline: Big Union Muscle For Obama Campaign
